creator: bloch@clearwellsystems.com
text:
I'm running 5.0.24 against 1.3.0_05
Fresh install using the .exe . marking as critical since the service appears doa

e Foundation\Tomcat 5.0\bin\bootstrap.jar
[2004-05-14 12:48:02] [982  prunsrv.c] [error] ServiceStart returned 2
[2004-05-14 12:48:02] [info] Run service finished.
[2004-05-14 12:48:02] [info] Procrun finished.

I would suggest that you use at least 1.3.1 version of JVM, and report if the 
problem is still present.

Your JVM has reported having version JNI_VERSION_1_1 instead minimum 1_2.
The procrun first tries to use the 1_4 version, and than falls back to 1_2.
creator: mturk@apache.org

text:
I can't use 1.3.1.  I was under the impression Tomcat 5 is spose to run under
most any 1.3 JDK.  This is may be a regression; I think 5.0.19 worked fine using
1.3.0_05.

-Eric
creator: bloch@clearwellsystems.com

text:
Then use the startup scripts, or another service wrapper. Please do not reopen
this report.
BTW, servlet 2.4 compliance requires JDK 1.4.
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
Thanks for the response.

It's certainly reasonable for Tomcat 5.0 to require the 1.4 JRE/JDK/JVM, but the
servlet spec doesn't have this requirement, I believe.  J2EE 1.4 compliance
requires the servlet spec 2.4, but not the otherway around.  

If you think I'm wrong, could you to point me to the lines in the 2.4 servlet
spec where it says that it *requires* JDK 1.4?  I couldn't find them.

I'll leave this bug closed since it's fine for Tomcat to not support 1.3; the
spec is ambivalent on that matter, I believe.  (Btw, I couldn't find anything in
the servlet spec about minimum jni versions either).



Thanks,
Eric
creator: bloch@clearwellsystems.com
